description: The government of Guinea-Bissau imposes a curfew with travel allowed only between the hours of 7:00 and 11:00.
The president of Guinea-Bissau declared that curfew ended on June 25 UPDATE: Curfew has been officially ended on June 25
The curfew in Guinea Bissau has been lifted as of July 18th and so public markets and transportation systems are reopening.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Guinea Bissau has implemented a state of emergency.

On Saturday, April 11, the President of Guinea-Bissau, General Umaro Sissoco Embalo, announced that the current state of emergency will be extended through Saturday, April 25, to halt further spread of the virus. UPDATE: The state of emergency has been extended from April 11th to April 25th

Guinea Bissau has implemented a state of emergency. The president of Guinea-Bissau, Umaro Sissoco Embaló, extended the state of emergency until May 11.
"The renewal of the state of emergency lasts for 15 days, starting at 00:00 on April 27, 2020 and ending at 00:00 on May 11, 2020", UPDATE: The president of Guinea-Bissau, Umaro Sissoco Embaló, extended the state of emergency until May 11

Guinea Bissau has implemented a state of emergency. The president of Guinea-Bissau Umaro Sissoco Embalo has decided to extend the state of emergency throughout the country until May 26, he announced on Monday in a presidential decree UPDATE: The president of Guinea-Bissau Umaro Sissoco Embalo has decided to extend the state of emergency throughout the country until May 26

Bissau-Guinean President Umaro Sissoco Embalo decided on Tuesday to extend the state of emergency for another 15 days until June 10 UPDATE: Bissau-Guinean President Umaro Sissoco Embalo decided on Tuesday to extend the state of emergency for another 15 days until June 10

President of Guinea-Bissau Umaro Sissoco Embalo announced on Wednesday to extend the state of emergency again for 15 days throughout the national territory, until June 25. UPDATE: President of Guinea-Bissau Umaro Sissoco Embalo announced on Wednesday to extend the state of emergency again for 15 days throughout the national territory, until June 25.

The President of Guinea-Bissau, Umaro Sissoco Embalo, announced a one-month extension until July 25 of the state of emergency decreed at the end of March to combat the coronavirus, double the usual duration. UPDATE: The state of emergency has been extended until July 25
In Guinea Bissau the state of emergency has been extended through July 25th 2020.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The state of emergency has been renewed in Guinea Bissau for an additional 30 days.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 17, authorities in Guinea-Bissau announced the closure of land borders and a ban on all flights landing at Osvaldo Viera International Airport beginning on Wednesday, March 18, 2020.
Restrictive measures have been introduced, in Guinea Bissau including the closure of all land and sea borders and commercial air links.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Guinea Bissau is utilizing IOM's application to collect data and monitor travelers at key entry points including the Capital's Osvaldo Vieira International Airport. 30 border patrol agents were trained in the use of a new surveillance system using tablets.

description: IOM has trained 125 community leaders in the regions of in the regions of Gabu, Oio, and Bafata of Guinea Bissau to spread awareness of preventative measures against the spread of COVID-19.
